node.title: Targeting 'fence-sitters' with 'FOMO' could lift Queensland's vaccination rates, experts say
node.alt: Georgie still gets asked by males why she works in a craft beer bar.
node.description: The Queensland government needs to do more to appeal to "fence-sitters" and smarter, stronger marketing strategies are needed to boost vaccination uptake and get the state over the finish line before borders reopen, experts warn.
node.content:
["The Queensland government needs to do more to target \"fence-sitters\"\u00a0and smarter, stronger marketing strategies are needed to boost vaccination uptake and get the state\u00a0over the finish line before borders reopen, experts warn.", "While Australia has reached\u00a0the 80 per cent full vaccination target, Queensland is still playing catch-up.", "Queensland is expected to reach the 80 per cent single-dose COVID-19 vaccination milestone today \u2014\u00a0the rate currently sits at 79.6 per cent.", "According to the latest figures, 67.4 per cent of Queenslanders aged 16 and older are fully vaccinated.", "However, jab rates in regional areas are still lagging behind \u2013 and time is of the essence.", "The Queensland government released\u00a0its roadmap to reopening the state's borders last month, but this has not resulted in a notable spike in vaccination uptake.", "In the past week, Cairns has had a 2.1 per cent increase in first doses, central Queensland recorded growth of 2.5 per cent and Ipswich 2 per cent.", "The Gold Coast recorded first dose growth of just 1.8 per cent.", "
Marketing experts suggest appealing to 'FOMO'
", "Griffith University consumer behaviour expert\u00a0Joy Parkinson said government efforts should focus on convincing \"fence-sitters\"\u00a0or the vaccine-hesitant.", "\"There's always a certain part of the population that are really hard to get to \u2013 to change their behaviours, whether that's to get them to give up smoking or to even wear a seatbelt, they're hesitant,\" she said.", "", "
Young people and those in regional Queensland have lower uptake rates than the rest of the state.(ABC North West Queensland: Emily Bissland)
", "From a marketing perspective, she suggests appealing to people's \"fear of missing out\" (FOMO) and using more \"positive\" language to tackle hesitancy.", "\"Fear of missing out if they can't go and do things, see family or friends or get to travel,\" Dr Parkinson said.", "\"Family is really important to most people, so if we talk about them being able to see their family, spend time with their family.", "\"I think really focusing on those good things is important,\" she said.", "
More tailored messaging needed for young people, regional Queenslanders
", "Queensland's young people in particular have been the slowest to heed the call to arms.", "\"Young people love to travel, they love to play sport, they love to go to nightclubs, so tapping into those things and the ability to be able to do those things, that's what we need to be pushing,\" Dr Parkinson said.", "\"Taking the hubs to them, making it seem that it's a really \"cool\" thing to do and also tapping into social media influencers.", "\"Young people are more influenced by their peers than the government or their parents telling them what to do.", "", "
Young people are more likely to absorb vaccination advice from their peers.(ABC News: Alice Pavlovic)
", "As for regional areas, Dr Parkinson said engaging trusted community leaders was key to prevent the spread of vaccine misinformation.", "\"In those regional communities, a lot of people really look up to community leaders, for example \u2014 mayors, the local footy club captain. So getting them out there and promoting getting vaccinated is really important.\"", "Lotteries, cash and\u00a0even free beer have been offered as incentives to help get skeptics through the doors of vaccination\u00a0centres.", "\"They work for those people who may have been thinking about it and just needed a bit of a push,\" Dr\u00a0Parkinson said.", "\"Perhaps that could work in our regional areas, if we haven't tried that strategy already.\"", "
Jab must be accessible, convenient
", "University of Queensland academic Tom Aechtner, a leading expert on vaccine hesitancy, said as \"many barriers as possible\" must be removed to make the jab accessible for all Queenslanders.", "The state government has tried to address that by\u00a0hosting pop-up vaccination hubs at schools, Bunnings stores, surf clubs and theme parks.", "", "
Pop-up vaccination clinics at places like schools or football stadiums can encourage fence-sitters to get the jab.(AAP: Glenn Hunt)
", "\"Improving access is the foundational starting point [to improving vaccination rates] so you need to start with that,\" Dr Aechtner said.", "\"You make it as easy as possible \u2014\u00a0put pop-up clinics near people's workplaces, have them open late so they don't have to leave work.\"", "Dr Aechtner said the limited impact of COVID outbreaks and \"no immediate motivation\" were the main contributors to Queensland's sluggish vaccine rates, particularly in regional areas.", "\"New South Wales could set targets and say, 'You can go out! \u2026\u00a0you're in lockdown and you can go out again'\u00a0and so there was a level of urgency added to it,\" Dr Aechtner said.", "\"Until that risk is there, sometimes people won't budge on vaccination.\"", "
Tackling fears about vaccine\u00a0safety
", "", "
All sorts of incentives have been offered to prompt people to get vaccinated.(ABC News: Larissa Waterson)
", "Dr Achetner said Queensland health authorities need\u00a0to \"acknowledge\" fears about the various vaccines \u2013 and then tailor messaging.", "\"Just throwing away or dismissing people's fears can be problematic because people's fears of protecting themselves or their family come from gut feelings,\" Dr Aechtner said.", "\"Talk to them [the vaccine-hesitant], hear what their concerns are and then create messaging that is specifically tailored to those communities.", "\"Letting people tell stories about why they chose to get vaccinated, maybe young people or having a younger COVID survivor share their story, that will be much more effective than just data.", "\"Consider doing fewer generic messages and more tailored messages to specific audiences.\"", "", "
